key_points: Prince Harry cited the British press 'destroying' his mental health as a reason for leaving royal life.
Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, stepped back from royal duties in January 2020, causing a crisis within the establishment.
They won't return to royal duties, and Harry will give up his honorary military titles, as confirmed by Buckingham Palace.
The couple has moved to Los Angeles, engaging with more sympathetic media figures.
Harry's interview with James Corden aired before a scheduled prime-time interview with Oprah Winfrey.
Harry expressed being more comfortable with the depiction of royal life in 'The Crown' than in newspapers.
Meghan won a privacy claim against the Mail on Sunday for publishing a letter she sent her father.
Harry and Meghan insist their move does not equate to walking away from public service, despite not returning as working royals.
Harry revealed personal details, including his Zoom calls with the Queen and Prince Philip, and Archie's first word.
The couple is expecting a second child, heightening interest in their lives post-royal departure.
